text:
- When the winter rolls around
and the weather gets cold,

a lot of people flock
to the hot destinations.

But there's something special
about the brisk weather

and winter destinations,
and if you embrace it,
you can learn to love it.
In this video, I'm gonna be talking about
my top 10 winter destinations
that you absolutely have to travel to.

Some of them I've been to,
some of them I haven't,
but I cannot wait.
And we're just gonna get right into it,

so grab that hot chocolate,
put on your tuque,

and let's travel to some
winter destinations.
(upbeat pop music)
And if you are new to this channel,
my name is Kristen Sarah,
and together with my husband Siya Zarrabi,
we are Hopscotch the Globe.
On this channel,

you are guaranteed to be
internationally inspired.

Whether you're gonna travel
halfway across the world

to a beautiful destination,
or just be in your...
the comfort of your own living room.

We want to inspire you to
bring culture into your life.
(upbeat pop music)
Number one, Greenland.

Specifically, Nuuk, and Ilulissat,
Ili, Ilu, Ilulu (laughs)
Ilulussat.
Ilulussat?
- [Siya] Ilulissat.
- Ee-Lee-Lu-Lu-Ssat (laughs)
Ilulussat
I think it was right.

Si and I went to Greenland
two years ago now

and it was one of the best
trips we've ever been on ever.

It was absolutely...I'm
getting chills right now

as I start to talk about it,
because it was so stunning.

It was like being on a
completely different planet,
it was peaceful,

it was silent, it like
made you feel warm inside

and it was so interesting the
way that they lived there.
It was completely different
than any other place in the world.

So, so freaking interesting,
oh my gosh. And it was so cold,

like I'm talking like
minus 30, minus 40 cold,
but if you were prepared

and you dressed
appropriately, there's so much
to enjoy there.
Some winter activities that we got up to
that we highly recommend are dog sledding,
really, really fun. And in Greenland they

are way more intense than
in any other country,

we like went off a click
on this like wooden sled,

with this like award
winning dog sled musher.

I think that's the right
title, probably not,
but whoa it was so thrilling.

Snowshoeing, the most intense
snowshoeing I've ever done.

You think how can
snowshoeing be intense, well,

go to Greenland and check
it out because it is.
What made the snowshoeing so intense was

the snow was super deep,
it was like 6 meters.

And we're going up mountains
and down mountains,
just over and over again.
It was like four, five hours
of snowshoeing straight. It was intense,
like it was cold out but we were hot.
We ended up taking off tons layers
because you're really burning a lot
when um, when you're in those conditions.
Taking a boat to see icebergs.
It blew my mind.

You have this idea of
what it's gunna be like
but it's not until you get like so close

to these giant pieces of ice
that you are just so blown away
and then it's just silent, too,

you just kind of hear the
wind and (sigh) Oh my God.

One of the best experiences
in my entire life, hands down.
(upbeat music)

Finland, oh we love Finland
so much, we've been twice.

We've been in summer and
we've been in the winter,
but is so special in the winter time.
Growing up, I believed in Santa Clause
and I mean he is real, let's face it.
But Santa Clause and reindeer,

and just like this magical
world that would come
to life during the December month.

And when you go to
Lapland, Finland you are
literally living your childhood dream.

There's reindeer everywhere.
There's more reindeer

than people that live there
and that is where Santa lives.

He has his whole workshop
there and you can go

and you can meet him, and he
speaks all different languages.
And he is the coolest guy ever.

We also stayed in a glass igloo,
which was really beautiful

in the winter because it
was just, you could see all

the snow outside and be
really cozy on the inside.
It was really cool.

Oh, we also stayed in an
olokolo, which was part

of this snow castle that
they build every year.

And you can actually
eat inside a snow castle
at a snow restaurant.

Of course when you go to
Finland all time of year
but it's extra special in the winter time.

You gotta go into the sauna,
sauna that's how they say it.

Sauna. And you get all
toasty and then you get out

and you roll in the snow
or you jump in a cold lake

and then you go back in
the sauna, back and forth.
It's really good for you
and its part of the Finnish culture.
(upbeat music)

Germany. You go to Germany
during the winter months
for the Christmas markets.
And they happen all around the country.

Now we think of Christmas
markets you might think

oh it's for children, but
in Germany it's for adults.

You got your gluhwein, you've
got tons of delicious food

that will warm your insides
and it's just really,
like it's really beautiful and cozy,

like a big hug when you're
walking through different market.
There's so many different artists

that are creating these
one of a kind pieces.
They make great gifts.

The food is so delicious.
The gluhwein, oh my God,
ah it's like...it's... it's hot wine.

So you're gunna really
feel warm and fuzzy inside.

As I mentioned you can
go all over the country
and visit all the different markets,

because each city has its own
and they're all super unique.

You can take the train,
go from city to city,
which is a lot of fun.

And the food is a big part
of being at these markets.

You gotta indulge in the food
and there's ton of street meat

so if you're a meat eater,
you are going to be in heaven.
(upbeat music)
Canada, eeey.
My home country.
My home and native land.

I cannot forget Canada
because there's so many spots

in Canada that are amazing
in the winter time.

There are so many
incredible places in Canada

to embrace the winter,
but three of my top are
Banff and Canmore,
Canmore, Banff
I really can't choose

and they're so close
together, that you can just go
to both even in one day.

And then there's Mont
Treblant and Yellowknife.
Banff and Canmore are these super cute

ski and snowboard villages
that really come to life

in the wintertime. They have
awesome shops, great food.

The ambiance is just...it's
like the ultimate place

to go in the winter.
Everyone's super happy
and really knows how to embrace the cold
and just get out and have a lot of fun.
Oh and of course, the mountains.
I cried for an hour and a half

staring at the mountains in
Banff the first time I saw them.
I...it like...it stopped me in my tracks
and I literally just bawled my eyes out.
I don't think I've ever felt that moved,
besides, seeing icebergs in Greenland
the way I felt in Banff, Alberta.
Mont Tremblant. We've been four times now

and it's, it never gets
old. It's so much fun there.

And again it's another
ski, snowboard village

located in Quebec and
it's a short, short flight

from Toronto. It takes an
hour. And it's super cute.

It's really colorful. There's
a lot of things you can do

in the winter there. People
really embrace the cold weather.

Mont Tremblant is actually
where I learned how to snowboard
and I have fallen in love with it,
so each winter now I go snowboarding.
Thanks to Mont Tremblant for teaching me.

You can go skiing. There's the
luge which is a lot of fun.

And what I really like
is you can basically like

take your skis and go
through out the village

and just park them right
besides a restaurant, go in,

have a really delicious
meal and come back out,
grab your skis and hit the slopes again.
Mont Tremblant is like a village resort,
you've got everything you need there.

You don't even have to
bring winter clothing,

or snowboards, or skis you
can rent everything there.
There's so many delicious restaurants,

so many different cuisines
from all around the world like

Italian, they've got
an amazing pizza joint.

Uh, really good sushi
too. Delicious Thai food.
Awesome ice cream. The list goes on.

Yellowknife in Northwest
Territories, oh my God,

I had one of the most amazing
experiences there as well.
Seeing the northern lights.

And I saw the northern
lights previous to going

to Yellowknife, but the northern
light there blew my mind.
Blew everyone's mind that was around me.

We were just like consumed
in this worm whole of colors
of greens and pinks and yellows and reds

and just dancing in the
sky right before our eyes.

It didn't even feel like it
was real, like...it was...
It was...It was unreal.

It literally left me
speechless that experience

and a lot of people that
I've spoken with who've been

to Yellowknife said that
it was the best place

to see the northern
lights for them as well.

During the winter months
is the best time to see

the northern lights in
Canada, in Yellowknife,

so head there during
the winter if you want

to see these beautiful crazy
lights dance before your eyes
in the sky that will blow your mind.
(upbeat music)
Lake Bled in Slovenia.
We went there I think about two years ago
with our friends and it is stunning.

There's this church that
is located in the middle
of Lake Bled with mountains behind it.

It's like one of the most
picturesque place in Europe.

And you can actually
take a boat to the church
and there's a bell there that you can ring

and make a wish and of
course it comes true.

There's several restaurants
and hotels around the area

where you can get a
beautiful view of the lake.

I highly recommend going
there if you're planning
a Euro trip in the winter time.

It's beautiful in the summer
as well but there's something
extra special about it in the winter time.
(upbeat music)
Yuzawa, Japan.

Located in central Japan
in the Chubu region,
there is a ski and snowboard village.

And the ski and snowboard
season stretches really long

because it is located in
the beautiful mountains.
Yuzawa is known for the hot springs,

for the public bath houses and
all you can drink sake shubs.
And if you're in Japan, you might as well

head on over to Nagano
to see the epic monkeys

chilling in the hot
springs, enjoying life,
the simple life, the peaceful life.

And of course, head on over
to Sapporo, like the beer,
the delicious beer, for the snow festival.
(upbeat music)

Vienna, Austria is so much
fun during the winter time
because it's ball season. By ball season,
I mean like Cinderella ball.

You get to dress up, you
get to take dance lessons

and learn the waltz so you
can hit the ball room floor
and impress everybody with your skills.
And you get to take a horse and carriage

to the ball if you'd like.
It's a fairy tale come true.
There a lot of really epic coffee houses

that have a lot of history
that you can go in,
have a coffee, warm up, have some pie,
have some schnitzel if you want.

There are also a lot amazing
markets where you can get some

one of a kind crafts by
really great artists.
(upbeat music)
Moscow, Russia, have not been there yet,

but its at the top of
my list to go to during

the winter time because it
is a winter paradise there.
They turn it up in the winter.
Turn it up! (laughs)
You can go skating in front of the famous

Saint Basil's Cathedral,
you can visit the market,
you can visit museums if you get too cold
and you want to go inside somewhere,

or if you want to stay outside
just indulge in some vodka.

And that is it for my top
10 winter destinations
you absolutely have to visit.

Weather it's a last
minute trip for this year,

plans for next year, or
the next year after that.
You just absolutely have to put them
at the top of your list.
For those of you who love hot weather,
who love being warm and that's why travel,

I challenge you to go to
one of these destinations

during the winter time and
really learn to embrace it
because you'll be surprised.

There's a lot you can do
during the cold weather
that you can't do during the hot weather.

And if you dress appropriately,
you will have so much fun.
Now it is your turn,

I want to know what are your
top winter destinations?
Let us all know by leaving a comment below

and tell us why you love
those winter destinations.
Inspire us. And I will see you guys later.
(upbeat music)
